message.content:
cs.CC, cs.DS, cs.DM, cs.GT, cs.CG. 

The paper deals with the query complexity of parameterized decision and optimization versions of several well-known problems in computer science, such as Hitting Set, Vertex Cover, Packing, Match, and Max-Cut. The focus is on the query complexity of Hitting Set, and the authors use an oracle known as \bis{} introduced by Beame et al.~\cite{BeameHRRS18} and its generalizations to hypergraphs. The paper also uses color coding and queries to the oracles to generate subsamples from the hypergraph, which is a common technique in computational complexity theory. Based on these factors, the most likely arXiv CS sub-categories for this paper are cs.CC (Computational Complexity) and cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms). Additionally, the paper deals with combinatorial optimization problems, which suggests that it could also be relevant to cs.DM (Discrete Mathematics) and cs.GT (Computer Science and Game Theory). Finally, the use of color coding and queries to the oracles involves geometric and graph-theoretic techniques, which could make the paper relevant to cs.CG (Computational Geometry).
